Welcome

My Personal Learning Journal

I currently work and play in the fascinating world of Large Language Models (LLMs) and AI Safety. With a MS Computer Science in Human Computer Interaction (HCI) at Stanford and a BA in Linguistics & Computer Science from UCLA, my journey began with freelance work in UI/UX research, programming, and design during the nascent stages of the web. Life took me on a rewarding detour to homeschool my kiddos. Now, I’m back, exploring the latest in AI and eager to share my lifelong love of learning with the world!

Current Projects

Check out the organizations I’m involved with, blending research, community, and advocacy.

  • FAR.AI: An AI Alignment research accelerator where I communicate findings to the broader ML research community. Projects I’ve enjoyed include : LLMs Learning Wellbeing, VLM-RM, Go Attack & Optimal Behavior Prior.

  • AiSafety.info: Serving in an advisory capacity, I contributed to the project management and development of the Q&A Chatbot, semantic search & UI/UX for early protoypes. This AI Safety FAQ platform addresses key inquiries in the field.

  • Women Techmakers Ambassadors: Supported by Google, this global initiative aligns with my dedication to creating an inclusive tech landscape where all women can flourish. My involvement extends to volunteering with AI4ALL, Technovation Challenge, Women Who Code & other events, reinforcing my commitment to this mission.

Further Explorations

Join me on a voyage of learning and discovery through a curated selection of AI/NLP Courses & Journals that have shaped my journey, alongside the myriad of books that fuel my curiosity on Goodreads. These resources and readings span the gamut from artificial intelligence to the wonderfully unexpected, offering a glimpse into the topics that capture my imagination.
